revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2013}} {{Infobox tennis biography |name=Ion Țiriac |image=Ion Tiriac.jpg |country={{ROM}} |residence=[[Bucharest]], Romania |birth_date={{birth date and age|df=yes|1939|05|09}} |birth_place=[[Brașov]], [[Kingdom of Romania]] |careerprizemoney= |height={{convert|1.85|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |turnedpro=1968 (amateur tour from 1962) |retired=1979 |plays=Right-handed (one-handed backhand) |tennishofyear=2013 |tennishofid=ion-tiriac |singlesrecord=167–177{{cite news|url=http://www.atpworldtour.com/Tennis/Players/Ti/I/Ion-Tiriac.aspx|work=Forbes|title=Profile at atpworldtour.com}} |singlestitles=1 |highestsinglesranking=No. 8 (1968, World's Top 10)Becker, Boris (2011). [https://books.google.com/books?id=PuKWHKIBwJEC&pg=PT28&lpg=PT28&dq=%22Ion+Tiriac%22+world+ranking+1968&source=bl&ots=HJ7QKQRblC&sig=lxIB_S-ZZypRujBbAyB1Cjtr71Y&hl=en&sa=X&ei=FhoeUbnkEuib0QXr5oGgAQ&ved=0CEAQ6AEwAw ''The Player''], Transworld Digital, Kindle Edition. |AustralianOpenresult=2R ([[1977 Australian Open (January) – Men's Singles|1977Jan]]) |FrenchOpenresult=QF ([[1968 French Open – Men's Singles|1968]]) |Wimbledonresult=4R ([[1967 Wimbledon Championships – Men's Singles|1967]], [[1972 Wimbledon Championships – Men's Singles|1972]]) |USOpenresult=3R ([[1973 US Open – Men's Singles|1973]]) |doublesrecord=294–141 |doublestitles=22 |highestdoublesranking=No. 19 (9 April 1979) |AustralianOpenDoublesresult= 2R ([[1977 Australian Open (January)#Men's Doubles|1977Jan]]) |FrenchOpenDoublesresult='''W''' ([[1970 French Open#Men's doubles|1970]]) |WimbledonDoublesresult=SF ([[1970 Wimbledon Championships#Men's doubles|1970]]) |Team=yes |DavisCupresult=F ([[1969 Davis Cup|1969Ch]], [[1971 Davis Cup|1971Ch]], [[1972 Davis Cup|1972]]) |medaltemplates-expand = yes |medaltemplates = {{MedalCountry|{{ROU}}}} {{MedalSport|[[Tennis]]}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Summer Universiade]]}} {{MedalBronze|[[Tennis at the 1961 Summer Universiade|1961 Sofia]]|Singles}} {{MedalBronze|[[Tennis at the 1961 Summer Universiade|1961 Sofia]]|Mixed Doubles}} {{MedalGold|[[Tennis at the 1965 Summer Universiade|1965 Budapest]]|Singles}} {{MedalGold|[[Tennis at the 1965 Summer Universiade|1965 Budapest]]|Mixed Doubles}} {{MedalBronze|[[Tennis at the 1965 Summer Universiade|1965 Budapest]]|Doubles}} }} '''Ion Țiriac''' ({{IPA-ro|iˈon t͡siriˈak}}; born 9 May 1939), also known as the 'Brașov Bulldozer'http://www.theroar.com.au/2016/04/28/madrid-open-preview is a [[Romania]]n businessman and former professional [[tennis]] and [[ice hockey]] player.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/10/billionaires-2010_Ion-Tiriac_TLQ2.html|work=Forbes|title=#937 Ion Tiriac|date=10 March 2010}} A former top 10 player, he is the winner of one grand slam title, the [[1970 French Open]] in men's doubles. Țiriac was the first man to play against a woman in a sanctioned tennis tournament (against Abigail Maynard, in 1975). The highlight of his ice hockey career was participating as defenseman in the Romanian national team at the [[1964 Winter Olympics]]. He gained notoriety in his (mostly) post-playing years as an advisor-coach-manager for the likes of [[Ilie Năstase]], [[Manuel Orantes]], [[Adriano Panatta]], [[Guillermo Vilas]], [[Henri Leconte]] and [[Boris Becker]]. Țiriac is the developer and owner of the [[Madrid Open (tennis)|Mutua Madrid Open]] masters tennis tournament.{{cite news|url=http://www.tennisworldusa.org/Madrid+Masters+goes+bling-articolo461.html|work=tennisworldusa|title=Madrid Masters goes bling|date=8 April 2011}} In 2013, he was elected as contributor into the [[International Tennis Hall of Fame]].{{cite news|url=http://www.itftennis.com/about/news/articles/hingis-elected-to-international-tennis-hall-of-fame.aspx|work=ITF Tennis|date=4 March 2013|accessdate=6 March 2013|title=Hingis elected to International Tennis Hall of Fame}} He has currently been managing French tennis player [[Lucas Pouille]] since December 2016. As a tennis player he played dramatic 5 setters against [[Rod Laver]], [[Stan Smith]], [[Jan Kodeš]] or [[Manuel Orantes]]. His singles record includes wins over [[Arthur Ashe]], [[Stan Smith]], [[Roscoe Tanner]], [[Manuel Orantes]], [[Andrés Gimeno]], [[Adriano Panatta]] or [[Nikola Pilić|Niki Pilić]]. He never won against compatriot [[Ilie Năstase]] in their six meetings. He played 3 [[Davis Cup]] finals (in 1969, 1971 and 1972).{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1970/07/18/archives/tiriac-upsets-smith-in-3-sets-nastase-ashe-and-richey-gain.html|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=18 July 1970|title=Tiriac Upsets Smith in 3 Sets; Nastase, Ashe and Richey Gain}} ==Sports career== He was born in [[Transylvania]], which is probably the reason why he has the nickname 'Count Dracula'.https://web.archive.org/web/20150402102043/http://thebiofile.com/2010/05/biofile-with-ion-tiriac Țiriac first appeared on the international sports scene as a child [[Table tennis|ping pong]] champion, then subsequently as an ice hockey player on the Romanian national team at the [[1964 Winter Olympics]]. Shortly after that he switched to tennis as his main sport. With fellow Romanian [[Ilie Năstase]] he won the men's doubles in the 1970 French Open and reached the [[Davis Cup]] finals several times in the 1970s.[http://www.daviscup.com/en/players/player/profile.aspx?playerid=10002372 Davis Cup Player Profile] [[John McPhee]] wrote of him that his drooping mustache suggests "that this man has been to places most people do not imagine exist. He appears to be a [[panatela]] ad, a triple agent from Alexandria, a used-car salesman from central Marrakesh. Tiriac has the air of a man who is about to close a deal in a back room behind a back room."[https://www.nytimes.com/1993/06/24/garden/at-wimbledon-with-ion-tiriac-tennis-s-grandest-bad-boy.html?pagewanted=all "AT WIMBLEDON WITH: Ion Tiriac; Tennis's Grandest Bad Boy,"] ''The New York Times''. Tiriac participated in the short period during the 1970s when women dabbled as coeds in established men's tennis tournaments. In his first match he defeated Abigail Maynard 6-0 6-0 in their round one match at [[United States Tennis Association|USTA]] pro circuit's Fairfiled County International Tennis Championship. It was the first time ever a female had entered a men’s tournament.{{Cite news|url=https://www.si.com/vault/1987/06/22/115606/count-dracula-transylvanian-tennis-guru-ion-tiriac-manager-and-mentor-of-boris-becker-has-sunk-his-teeth-into-many-a-juicy-business-deal|title=COUNT DRACULA|last=Kirkpatrick|first=Curry|work=SI.com|access-date=2017-09-20}}{{Cite web|url=http://cliffdrysdale.com/news/mens-pro-circuit-tennis-tournament-returns-to-fairfield-after-24-years|title=MEN’S USTA PRO CIRCUIT TENNIS TOURNAMENT RETURNS TO FAIRFIELD AFTER 24 YEARS {{!}} Cliff Drysdale Tennis|website=cliffdrysdale.com|language=en|access-date=2017-09-20}} After his retirement, he served as coach and manager for players such as [[Ilie Năstase]], [[Guillermo Vilas]], [[Mary Joe Fernández]], [[Goran Ivanišević]] and [[Marat Safin]].{{cite news|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2009/writers/sl_price/09/02/marat.safin/index.html|work=CNN|title=In praise of Safin – the head case|date=2 September 2009}} He became the [[sports agent]] of [[Boris Becker]] and managed his career from 1984 to 1993. In 1998 he became president of the [[Romanian Olympic and Sports Committee]]. Țiriac ran major men's events in Germany, including the season-ending championships in [[ATP World Tour Finals|Hanover]]. Although tennis is now a much smaller part of his portfolio and occupies only 5 percent of his time, he has taken particular pleasure and pride in making [[Mutua Madrileña Madrid Open|Madrid Tennis Open]] a combined men's and women's event with €7.2 million in total prize money.{{cite news|title=Spain at Last Brings the World to Its Clay|publisher=New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/05/09/sports/tennis/09iht-SRMADRID.html?pagewanted=all|accessdate=13 May 2009|first=Christopher|last=Clarey|date=9 May 2009}} The trophy awarded to the tournament winner bears his name. Țiriac also holds the license for the [[BRD Năstase Ţiriac Trophy|BRD Năstase Țiriac Trophy]] tennis tournament since 1996. It is currently a €450,000 event, part of the [[ATP World Tour 250 series]], held annually in [[Bucharest]], [[Romania]], just 2 weeks before the Madrid Open. In 2012 he was nominated for the [[International Tennis Hall of Fame]] in the contributor category.{{cite news|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5j_yfTpp-I45pcBlk5tHnihPmu0_g?docId=c0c839f8c28f45f89214622250d580b1|title= Hingis, Stich, Sukova nominated for tennis hall|date=9 September 2012}} On 13 July 2013 he joined the [[International Tennis Hall of Fame]] as a successful promoter and tournament director for numerous events including the two of the largest Masters 1000 events, the Italian Open and the Madrid Masters. ==Business career== [[File:Rolls Royce Phantom IV 1952.JPG|thumb|left|One of two [[Rolls-Royce Phantom IV]] owned by Țiriac, part of his car collection.[http://www.tiriaccollection.ro/en] The Tiriac Collection]] After his retirement as a professional tennis player, Țiriac became a businessman in Germany. In 1987, he appeared in a TV commercial for [[Miller Lite]] beer with [[Bob Uecker]], who extols Țiriac's supposed humorous qualities, laughing hysterically while Țiriac sits stone-faced. Following the collapse of communism in Romania, he started numerous businesses and investments back home. In 1990, he founded Banca Țiriac, the first private bank in post-Communist Romania. Between that and several other enterprises (retail, insurance, auto leasing, auto dealerships, airlines, etc.), his fortune was estimated at over US$900 million in 2005. Ion Țiriac is a car collector. Tiriac Collection represents the exhibition of cars and motorcycles of Mr. Ion Tiriac. Reopened to the public in May 2015, the collection includes historical vehicles manufactured since 1899 and also modern exotics with about 350 cars and 165 cars at full time display on a rotation basis.{{cite web|url=http://supercars.agent4stars.com/power-cars/ion-tiriac-collection-romania}} Visitors will find the only collection in the world with 2 Rolls-Royce Phantoms IV, as well as exhibits that previously belonged to great names such as Sir [[Elton John]], [[Sammy Davis Jr.]] or [[Bernie Ecclestone]]. Ion Țiriac became the first Romanian to enter [[Forbes]]' [[Forbes list of billionaires (2007)|List of billionaires]] in the 2007 Forbes rankings, ranking 840th in the world. His wealth was estimated at $1.0 billion as of 2010, according to the magazine.{{cite news|title=the World's Billionaires – No. 937 Ion Tiriac|url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/10/billionaires-2010_Ion-Tiriac_TLQ2.html|publisher=Forbers|accessdate=1 July 2012|date=10 March 2010}} In 2010, TOP 300 Capital declared Ion Țiriac the richest man in Romania with a wealth estimated at €1.5–€1.6 billion ($2–$2.2 billion).{{cite web|url=http://english.hotnews.ro/stiri-business-7942996-top-300-capital-declares-ion-tiriac-the-richest-man-romania-followed-businessmen-dinu-patriciu-and-ioan-niculae.htm|title=TOP 300 Capital declares Ion Tiriac the richest man in Romania followed by businessmen Dinu Patriciu and Ioan Niculae |accessdate=March 8, 2014}} In 2018, Ion Tiriac ranked #1867 on the ''Forbes'' World's Billionaires list, with wealth listed at US $1.2 billion.https://www.forbes.com/billionaires/list/3/#version:static_header:source [[File:Stamps of Romania, 2015-086.jpg|thumb|Ion Tiriac on Romanian postage stamp]] == Personal life == Țiriac was married to Erika Braedt, a [[handball]] player, between 1963 and 1965.{{cite web|title=Sergiu Nicolaescu: "Da, am cunoscut-o pe Erika"|url=http://www.libertatea.ro/detalii/articol/sergiu-nicolaescu-da-am-cunoscut-o-pe-erika-231464.html|language=Romanian|accessdate=25 May 2012}} He has a son, Ion Țiriac Jr., with Mikette von Issenberg, a [[Model (person)|fashion model]]; and further two children with Karim Mihai and Ioana Natalia, with Sophie Ayad, an Egyptian [[journalist]].{{cite web|title=Fetița lui Țiriac, în vacanță în România|url=http://stiri.acasa.ro/monden-124/mama-lui-tiriac-jr-o-milionara-excentrica-126406.html|language=Romanian|accessdate=25 May 2012}}{{cite web|title=Mama lui Tiriac jr., o milionara excentrica|url=http://stiri.acasa.ro/monden-124/mama-lui-tiriac-jr-o-milionara-excentrica-126406.html|language=Romanian|accessdate=15 May 2012}}{{cite web|title=Jean Maurer dezvaluie motivul ranchiunii dintre Ion Tiriac si Sergiu Nicolaescu |url=http://www.ziare.com/stiri/ancheta/jean-maurer-dezvaluie-motivul-ranchiunii-dintre-ion-tiriac-si-sergiu-nicolaescu-938355|language=Romanian|accessdate=25 May 2012}} ==Career statistics== ===Grand Slam finals=== ====Doubles 2 (1–1)==== {|class=wikitable ! !width=75|Outcome !width=175|Championship !width=175|Partnering !width=175|Opponents !width=150|Score |-bgcolor=EBC2AF |1966 |bgcolor=#FFA07A|Runner-up||French Open||{{flagicon|Romania|1965}} [[Ilie Năstase]]||{{Flagicon|USA}} [[Dennis Ralston]]

{{EngvarB|date=April 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2015}} {{Infobox person |name = James Duncan |image = |caption = |birth_name = |birth_date = 1834 |birth_place = [[Greenock]], [[Glasgow]], Scotland |residence = London, England |occupation = Sugar refiner, art collector |years_active = 1834–1905 | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1905|05|08|1834|01|11}} | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = |networth = |spouse = |website = |children = | parents = | religion = }} '''James Duncan''' (1834–1905) was a Scottish [[Sugar refinery|sugar refiner]] and businessman, who then became a philanthropist and art collector. His house and grounds in Glasgow became Benmore Botanic Garden, managed by Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh.
==Biography== Duncan was born in 1834 in Greenock. He was the son of a second-hand bookseller.<ref name=sugargiant>Philippe Chalmin {{Google books|bOPogF8v9-kC|The Making of a Sugar Giant: Tate and Lyle, 1859–1989|page=61}}</ref>
In the early 1850s, James Duncan was studying chemistry at Glasgow. He had a break and took a boat trip from Greenock to the lochs and coastlines of [[Argyllshire]]. While on [[Loch Long]], he conceived a unique method of refining sugar.<ref name=introduncan>{{cite web |url=http://www.rbge.org.uk/assets/files/Publications/Pages%20from%20jamesduncanbook0710-.pdf |title=Introduction to James Duncan |date=13 July 2010|publisher=www.rbge.org.uk | format=PDF |accessdate=6 January 2014}}</ref> He patented his idea for sugar refining. Then between 1858 and 1861, he became a partner of the Greenock firm of 'Duncan, Bell & Scott'.<ref name=sugargiant/><ref name=introduncan/> In 1854, the refinery was producing up to 50,000 tons.<ref>William H Marwick {{Google books|etRcAgAAQBAJ|Scotland in Modern Times|page=99}}</ref>
After 1861, he developed a factory in [[Silvertown]], London, at [[List of locations in the Port of London|Millbank]] 21 Mincing Lane,<ref name=roots>{{cite web |title= Topic: James Duncan of Benmore & Mary Moubray family |date=24 October 2008 |url=http://www.rootschat.com/forum/index.php?topic=336589.0 |publisher=rootschat.com |accessdate=4 January 2014}}</ref> called the 'Clyde Wharf Refinery'.<ref name=sugargiant/> It was the largest and most profitable sugar refinery in London.<ref name=introduncan/><ref name=sugarcane>{{cite journal |last=Martineau |first=George |date=February 1918 |title=Sugar cane and beet, an object lesson|url=https://archive.org/stream/sugarcanebeetobj00martuoft/sugarcanebeetobj00martuoft_djvu.txt |journal=Sugar Cane |volume=4 |accessdate=6 January 2014}}</ref> He was always refining the process and learning different applications to keep his company at the top of the industry. At the peak of the business, they were producing up to 2 thousand tons of sugar a week.<ref name=sugargiant/><ref name=sugarcane/>
In 1878 he was elected fellow of the [[Society of Chemical Industry]], later becoming its Vice-President. By 1879 he held the prestigious post of 'Chairman of the Sugar Refiners' Committee',<ref name=sugarcane/> and also became Vice-President of the 'Railway and Canal Traders' Union'.<ref name=introduncan/>
In 1884, cheap German sugar arrived in the UK, which was much cheaper than UK produced sugar.<ref name=roots/><ref name=sugarcane/>
In August 1885, he published an article in the 'Sugar Cane' journal, titled 'The bounty on exportation of refined sugar from the United States'.<ref>{{cite web |title=The bounty on exportation of refined sugar from the United States |url=http://search.socialhistory.org/Record/153891/Details |publisher=search.socialhistory.org |accessdate=6 January 2014}}</ref>
In 1886, the unfair foreign competition meant that he had to close his London works of Clyde Wharf.<ref name=sugarcane/>
He returned to Scotland, to manage the smaller refinery business in Greenock. After he retired, he spent time with his sister 'Mary Moubray' in [[Strone]], and then spent the winter months in Italy.<ref name=roots/>
==Philanthropy== James Duncan's charitable work was widely known throughout Britain. he gave 20 per cent of his annual £100,000 salary to a range of causes, making him one of the most committed [[philanthropists]] of the time.<ref name=sugargiant/><ref name=introduncan/><ref name=building>{{cite web |first=Mary| last=Gibby |url=http://www.buildingconservation.com/articles/benmore-fernery/benmore-fernery.htm |title=The Benmore Fernery |year=2013 |website=www.buildingconservation.com |accessdate=4 January 2014}}</ref><ref name=culture>{{cite web |first=Richard |last=Moss |title=Enlightened Victorian James Duncan comes home to the Benmore Botanic Garden in Argyll |date=14 March 2011 |url=http://www.culture24.org.uk/history-and-heritage/work-and-daily-life/rural-heritage/art349955 |publisher=culture24.org.uk |accessdate=15 October 2014}}</ref><ref name=scotsman>{{cite news |title=Philanthropist, tycoon and great Scot: James Duncan's time has come again |date=3 March 2011 |url=http://www.scotsman.com/news/philanthropist-tycoon-and-great-scot-james-duncan-s-time-has-come-again-1-1503538 |publisher=scotsman.com |accessdate=15 October 2014}}</ref>
He also built 2 churches for 2 different congregations.<ref name=sugargiant/>
He was known as a major collector of fine art and was also a lender of pictures to annual exhibitions, including the [[Royal Glasgow Institute of the Fine Arts]]. In 1878, he was elected Vice-President of the Royal Glasgow Institute of the Fine Arts. He regularly contributed works to European exhibitions, including the most prestigious at the [[Paris Salon]], and to key international exhibitions of art and industry in France and Germany in the 1870s and 1880s.<ref name=introduncan/>
He was the first Scottish collector of an [[Impressionist]] work including purchasing in 1883, [[Renoir]]'s painting 'Bay of Naples'.<ref name=scotsman/> The painting was later lent to the [[National Gallery of Scotland]] by the [[Metropolitan Museum of Art]] in New York (who now own it), for a summer exhibition about James Duncan's collection.<ref name=roots/> Duncan was also one of the most valued and important clients of the influential French picture dealer [[Paul Durand-Ruel]], and regularly frequented the studios of Europe's most famous painters.<ref name=introduncan/> He collected works by the likes of [[Raeburn]] and [[Jean-Baptiste-Camille Corot|Corot]],<ref name=building/> including [[Eugène Delacroix]]'s masterpiece ''Death of Sardanapalus'.<ref name=culture/>
He was friends with various people in different fields of work including; the chemist [[James Young (Scottish chemist)|James "Paraffin" Young]], who established the world's first commercial oil works; the pioneering ophthalmic surgeon 'Dr Neven Gordon Cluckie', whose work led to the establishment of eye surgeries in hospitals throughout Britain; the celebrated preacher [[Charles Spurgeon]]; [[Henry Boyd (academic)|Rev. Henry Boyd]] (Principal of [[Hertford College Oxford]], 1878–1922), with whom Duncan had worked closely in the 1870s to improve working conditions in London's East End; and [[Gustave Doré]], the French artist whose gallery, paintings and book illustrations proved so popular in Britain.<ref name=introduncan/><ref name=culture/> “Duncan also employed his significant wealth in helping the poor in Scotland and England and improving the working conditions of his workforce, building churches and schools, providing medical care and introducing an eight-hour working day." noted Peter Baxter (Benmore House Curator).<ref name=culture/>
Duncan had also been in contact with the eminent botanist [[Sir Joseph Dalton Hooker]] and with [[Henry Morton Stanley]], the explorer and friend of [[David Livingstone]] who visited Duncan some time in the 1870s or 1880s.<ref name=introduncan/>
In [[Kilmun]], at Graham's Point there is a memorial to James Duncan. Which was designed by A. Macfarlane Shannon.<ref>{{cite web |title=Kilmun, Graham's Point, Memorial to James Duncan, Kilmun |url=http://www.britishlistedbuildings.co.uk/sc-50435-kilmun-graham-s-point-memorial-to-james-d |publisher=britishlistedbuildings.co.uk| accessdate=17 January 2015}}</ref>
==Benmore House== In 1870, James Duncan purchased Benmore House near Dunoon, Argyll.<ref name=building/><ref name=benmore>{{cite web|first=Donald |last=Stalker |title=Transactions of the Highland and Agricultural Society of Scotland Plantations of the Estates of Benmore and Kilmun, Argyllshire |url=http://www.electricscotland.com/agriculture/page45.htm |publisher=electricscotland.com |accessdate=15 October 2014}}</ref> He then set about building a gallery (to showcase his large collection of fine arts. As well as a [[fernery]] and one of the largest greenhouses in Scotland.<ref name=culture/>
The estates amounted up to 12,260 acres of land. He made extensive improvements to the land. On some of which he grazed ''West Highland cattle'' and [[Scottish Blackface|blackfaced sheep]]. The sheep were first seen at the [[Paris International Exhibition of 1878]]. His flock of sheep gained awards at the annual exhibitions of the Highland and Agricultural Society of Scotland.<ref name=benmore/>
He also had over six million trees planted as part of the large landscape alterations he had designed. Including, commissioning features such as the 'Golden Gates'.Which were earlier shown at the Paris International Exhibition.<ref name=scotsman/>
Following the introduction of a German sugar bounty, Duncan had a massive loss of fortune and had to sell the estate in 1889.<ref name=building/>
It was acquired by the Young Family and later gifted to [[Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh]]<ref name=roots/> It is now the [[Benmore Botanic Garden]].
His art collection at Benmore was split up and sold, his paintings are now housed in some of world's greatest museums such as the [[Louvre]], the [[Belvedere, Vienna|Belvedere]] in Vienna, the [[Art Institute of Chicago]] and the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, which is home to four of Duncan's pictures.<ref name=roots/><ref name=scotsman/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==Other sources== *McDonald Watson. Andrew, 5 July 2010, James Duncan: An Enlightened Victorian, Scotland, Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh, {{ISBN|978-1906129330}}
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Duncan, James}} [[Category:1834 births]] [[Category:1905 deaths]] [[Category:Scottish businesspeople]]

revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=December 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = James (Jim) Christensen | image = Jim_Christensen_Economist_Investor_and_Mathematician.jpg | caption = Jim Christensen speaking at an investment conference in 2012 | birth_place = [[Childers]], [[Queensland]] | education = [[University of Queensland]] | nationality = Australian | occupation = economist, investor, mathematician }}
'''James (Jim) Christensen''' is an economist, investor and mathematician who is currently the managing director for Global Multi-Asset at [[Queensland Investment Corporation]]. He is the former [[Chief Investment Officer]] of [[Telstra Super]] which is Australia's largest corporate superannuation fund. He has over 20 years of experience and has been widely successful in the Australian investment industry. James is heavily quoted on his economic viewpoints in various Australian and international media, and presents at numerous functions.
==Career== Jim began his career working in Queensland Treasury before moving on to the [[Queensland Investment Corporation]] (QIC). He spent over 10 years at the QIC managing some of the $54 billion the organisation was then responsible for.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.qic.com.au/who-is-qic/ |title=QIC Dynamic Investment Solutions :: Who is QIC |publisher=QIC |date=30 September 2010 |accessdate=12 December 2010}}</ref> At this company Jim was given the position of Managing Director of the Active Management Division as well as chairing the alpha investment committee.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.investordaily.com.au/archive/1346.xml |title=QIC appoints head of alpha |publisher=InvestorDaily |date=2 March 2007 |first=Charlie |last=Corbett |accessdate=12 December 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110412023330/http://investordaily.com.au/archive/1346.xml |archivedate=12 April 2011 |df= }}</ref> Ultimately, this meant Jim was responsible for determining and implementing investment strategies across all portfolios.
Jim was appointed to the role of [[Chief Investment Officer]] at [[Telstra Super]] in 2009 on 16 December, succeeding Steve Merlicek.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.investordaily.com.au/cps/rde/xchg/id/style/8251.htm |archive-url=https://archive.is/20121230103034/http://www.investordaily.com.au/cps/rde/xchg/id/style/8251.htm |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2012-12-30 |title=Telstra Super appoints CIO |publisher=InvestorDaily |date=17 December 2009 |first=Julie |last=May |accessdate=12 December 2010 }}</ref> He managed over $15 billion for the company.<ref>{{cite press release |url=http://www.telstrasuper.com.au/files/a766c4ca-60ea-4d41-9ff1-9ce1009eb8dd/MR_Telstra_Super_appoints_CIO.pdf |title=New Chief Investment Officer to continue award winning performance |publisher=TelstraSuper |date=16 December 2009 |accessdate=12 December 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110107111321/http://www.telstrasuper.com.au/files/a766c4ca-60ea-4d41-9ff1-9ce1009eb8dd/MR_Telstra_Super_appoints_CIO.pdf# |archive-date=7 January 2011 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The company is the largest corporate pension fund in Australia, with over 100,000 members.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telstrasuper.com.au/About_us/Facts_figures |title=Telstra Super Facts |publisher=Telstra Super |date=30 June 2012 |accessdate=8 February 2013}}</ref>
On 24 November 2015 Jim officially resigned from Telstra Super to return QIC, this time as Managing Director for Global Multi Asset.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.afr.com/business/banking-and-finance/telstra-super-cio-jim-christensen-resigns-20151124-gl6tu2 |title=Telstra Super CIO Jim Christensen resigns |publisher=Australian Financial Review |date=24 November 2015 |accessdate=2 October 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.moneymanagement.com.au/news/superannuation/telstra-super-cio-moves-back-qic-after-five-years |title=Telstra Super CIO moves back to QIC after five years |publisher=Money Management |date=25 November 2015 |accessdate=2 October 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ai-cio.com/channel/NEWSMAKERS/Australian-Corporate-CIO-Exits-for-Asset-Manager/ |title=Australian Corporate CIO Exits for Asset Manager |publisher=Chief Investment Officer |date=24 November 2015 |accessdate=2 October 2015}}</ref> Jim will now be responsible for asset allocation and active management at the $74.6 Billion fund.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.qic.com.au/knowledge-centre/gma-media-release-20151124 |title=QIC Appoints Jim Christensen as Managing Director, Global Multi Asset |publisher=Queensland Investment Corporation |date=24 November 2015 |accessdate=2 October 2015}}</ref> QIC is, as of Jim's appointment, the second largest investment fund in the country. In taking the position Jim has taken over from the departing CIO Adriaan Ryder who left after 7 years with the company.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ai-cio.com/channel/NEWSMAKERS/QIC-CIO-Departs-for-Middle-Eastern-Fund/ |title=QIC CIO Departs for Middle Eastern Fund |publisher=Chief Investment Officer |date=4 February 2016 |accessdate=2 October 2015}}</ref>
==In the media== Over his career Jim has been featured in a number of live, televised and written pieces of media. His economic opinions have been recorded in leading magazines, journals and newspapers. These articles most commonly depict investment strategies with a particular focus on corporate asset management.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.top1000funds.com/profile/2013/08/07/telstrasuper-size-conscious-success/ |title=TelstraSuper: size-conscious success |publisher=Top 1000 Funds |date=7 August 2013 |first=David |last=Rowley |accessdate=8 September 2013}}</ref> As a speaker Jim has presented at public functions around the world including conferences with the Centre for Investor Education (CIE) and the Fund Executives Association Ltd (FEAL).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cie.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2013/02/CIO13_FinalAgenda_250213_1.pdf |title=Chief Investment Officers Symposium |publisher=Centre for Investor Education |date=27 February 2013 |accessdate=8 September 2013 }}{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.feal.asn.au/multiattachments/3161/DocumentName/FEALProgram.pdf |title=FEAL National Conference |publisher=Fund Executives Association Ltd |date=4 August 2010 |accessdate=8 September 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150518073028/http://www.feal.asn.au/multiattachments/3161/DocumentName/FEALProgram.pdf |archivedate=18 May 2015 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cairnspost.com.au/business/port-douglas-draws-conference-with-delegates-holding-4-trillion-investment-funds/news-story/d05ce5ae7b8982239a6c18986fe65cdf |title=Port Douglas draws conference with delegates holding $4 trillion investment funds |work=The Cairns Post |date=20 October 2016 |accessdate=22 May 2017}}</ref> In addition to this he is often shown in online investor education videos.
The returns of his funds investments are also heavily highlighted and scrutinised across Australian media. For the most part funds under his control are usually industry leaders.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.afr.com/personal-finance/supers-great-gains-wont-be-repeated-20140801-j6yvj |title=Super's great gains won't be repeated |publisher=Australian Financial Review |first=Sally |last=Patten |date=2 August 2014 |accessdate=23 April 2015}}</ref> In 2015 Jim was listed as a nominee for the prestigious Conexus Financial Superannuation CIO of the Year award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://investmentmagazine.com.au/2015/03/cio-of-the-year-shortlist-announced/ |title=CIO of the Year Shortlist Announced |work=Investment Magazine |date=30 March 2015 |first=Dan |last=Purves |accessdate=23 April 2015}}</ref> He proceeded to win the Award, edging out his competitors at the gala event.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://investmentmagazine.com.au/2015/05/christensen-is-chief-investment-officer-of-the-year/ |title=Jim Christensen: CIO of the Year |work=Investment Magazine |first=David |last=Rowley |date=21 May 2015 |accessdate=21 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.professionalplanner.com.au/superannuation/2015/05/21/telstra-supers-jim-christensen-named-superannuation-cio-of-the-year-36901/ |title=Christensen Named CIO of the Year |publisher=Professional Planner |first=Dan |last=purves |date=21 May 2015 |accessdate=22 May 2015}}</ref> In addition to this award he went on to win CIO of the year at the Rainmaker awards in the same year.
It was reported that James was the fifth highest paid Investment Officer in the Super Industry for 2015; the highest of any corporate fund.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://investmentmagazine.com.au/2015/02/super-salary-survey-how-do-they-line-up/ |title=Super Salary Survey |date=11 February 2015 |first=David |last=Rowley |accessdate=21 May 2015}}</ref> That same year it was also shown, to some controversy, that Jim earns over $500, 000 more than the CEO of Telstra Super.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://investmentmagazine.com.au/2015/02/22-chief-investment-officers-out-earn-chief-executives/ |title=Chief Investment Officers out earn chief executives |work=Investment Magazine |date=2 February 2015 |first=Dan |last=Purves |accessdate=23 April 2015}}</ref>
==Education== James grew up in [[Childers, Queensland]] in Australia. After completing high school in [[Gin Gin, Queensland]] he went on to study at the prestigious [[University of Queensland]]. He holds a Bachelor of Science (BSc), [[Bachelor of Economics]] (BEc) and [[Master of Economics]] (MEc).
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Christensen, Jim}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Australian businesspeople]] [[Category:University of Queensland alumni]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Jorge Mendes | image = File:Jorge Mendes - Globe Soccer Awards 2013.jpg | caption = Mendes in 2013 | birth_name = Jorge Paulo Agostinho Mendes | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1966|01|07|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Lisbon]], Portugal | nationality = Portuguese | occupation = [[Sports agent|Football agent]] | years_active = 1996–present | employer = [[GestiFute]] }}
'''Jorge Paulo Agostinho Mendes''' (born 7 January 1966), better known simply as '''Jorge Mendes''', is a Portuguese [[association football|football]] [[sports agent|agent]]. He is registered with the [[Portuguese Football Federation]]<ref>[https://www.fifa.com/aboutfifa/organisation/footballgovernance/playeragents/association=por.html Players' Agents List], fifa.com, retrieved 30 March 2015</ref> and heads the [[GestiFute]] company, founded in 1996.<ref>[http://www.gestifute.com/gestifute/quemsomos.php "GestiFute: About Us"] {{webarchive|url=http://arquivo.pt/wayback/20090723235400/http://www.gestifute.com/gestifute/quemsomos.php |date=23 July 2009 }} Retrieved 2 August 2010.</ref> Mendes is among the most influential football agents in the world, with clients including [[Cristiano Ronaldo]], [[David de Gea]], [[José Mourinho]], [[Diego Costa]], and [[James Rodríguez]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Burt|first1=Jason|title=Diego Costa: I take things to limit but I did nothing wrong|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea/11381605/Diego-Costa-I-take-things-to-limit-but-I-did-nothing-wrong.html|accessdate=1 February 2015|work=The Daily Telegraph|date=31 January 2015}}</ref><ref name="mendestel">[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/10085617/Monaco-break-the-bank-with-110m-spree-and-send-out-warning-to-Europes-giants.html "Monaco break the bank with £110m spree and send out warning to Europe's giants"] by Oliver Brown, ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'', 28 May 2013</ref><ref>[https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/renato-sanches-to-bayern-munich-manchester-united-target-moves-to-bundesliga-champions-in-276million-a7022181.html "Renato Sanches to Bayern Munich: Manchester United target moves to Bundesliga champions for £27.6million"] by Mark Critchley, ''[[The Independent]]'', 10 May 2016</ref><ref>[http://en.as.com/en/2016/07/17/football/1468753760_104958.html "Transfers | Real Madrid and Barça do battle for Valencia's André Gomes - AS.com"] ''[[Diario AS]]'', 17 July 2016</ref> Mendes is often referred to as a "super-agent".<ref name="mendestel"/><ref name=rise/><ref>[http://www.marca.com/2013/05/28/en/football/international_football/1369775727.html "Falcao on the verge of Monaco move"], ''[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]'', 28 May 2013</ref>
Mendes has been named ''Best Agent of the Year'' at the [[Globe Soccer Awards]] six consecutive times, from 2010 to 2015.<ref>[http://www.globesoccer.com/winners/jorge-mendes-best-agent-year/ "Jorge Mendes (Best Agent of the Year)], ''[[Globe Soccer Awards]]''</ref>
==Early career== Mendes began as a footballer but was forced to abandon his hopes of a professional career after being rejected by a number of Portuguese clubs when he was in his early 20s.<ref name="bar">[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/premier_league/article6481331.ece "Jorge Mendes: from bar owner to football super-agent"] by Matt Hughes, ''[[The Times]]'', 12 June 2009. Retrieved 2 August 2010. (subscription required)</ref> Instead, he ran a video rental store, worked as a [[Disc jockey|DJ]] and opened a bar and nightclub in [[Caminha]].<ref name="rise">[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/jan/18/jorge-mendes-profile-agent "Jorge Mendes: The rise and rise of Portugal's super-agent"] by David Conn, ''[[The Guardian]]'', 18 January 2011. Retrieved 14 January 2015.</ref><ref name="bar"/>
==Career as an agent==
===First deals=== Mendes' first deal as a football agent came in 1996 when he brokered [[Nuno Espírito Santo|Nuno]]'s move from [[Vitória S.C.|Vitória de Guimarães]] to [[Deportivo de La Coruña]]. He had met the goalkeeper in a bar in [[Guimarães]].<ref name="bar"/> After that deal, Mendes gradually attracted more Portuguese players, including [[Jorge Andrade]]. [[Hugo Viana]]'s move from [[Sporting Clube de Portugal|Sporting CP]] to [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in the [[Premier League]] for around €12 million in 2002 was his first major international transfer.<ref name="bar"/><ref>[http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/news/newsid=26854.html "Newcastle close on Viana"]; UEFA.com, 20 June 2002. Retrieved 2 August 2010.</ref> Part of Mendes' success was ostensibly based on his frequent presence at football schools and youth teams throughout Portugal, spotting and signing young players, as he did with [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] and [[Ricardo Quaresma]].<ref name="How"/>
It has been reported that Mendes came to physical blows at the [[Lisbon Portela Airport|Portela Airport]] in [[Lisbon]] with [[Luís Figo]]'s agent, José Veiga, whose influence he was gradually supplanting at this time.<ref name="rise"/> Mendes has also been accused by other agents of moving in on their players shortly before agreeing major deals.<ref name="rise"/>
===Mourinho and Chelsea=== In 2004, Mendes brokered [[José Mourinho]]'s move from [[FC Porto|Porto]] to manage [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], despite Mourinho already having an agent, José Baidek, whom Mourinho had known since his time at [[U.D. Leiria|União de Leiria]] and who had reportedly lined up a move to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref name="How">[https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/how-mendes-has-made-himself-key-player-behind-the-biggest-deals-in-europe-846361.html "How Mendes has made himself key player behind the biggest deals in Europe"], by Jason Burt, ''[[The Independent]]'', 13 June 2008. Retrieved 14 January 2015.</ref> Mourinho and Mendes negotiated with the agent [[Pini Zahavi]], who acted as Chelsea's representative.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/3692469.stm "Mourinho ready for Chelsea"], [[BBC]], 7 May 2004. Retrieved 14 January 2015.</ref>
The deal established Mendes's importance. He built up a roster of the leading Portuguese players and every Portuguese player that followed Mourinho to Chelsea was a client of Mendes, including [[Ricardo Carvalho]], [[Paulo Ferreira]], [[Tiago Mendes|Tiago]] and [[Maniche]].<ref name="How"/> Mendes was paid by Chelsea to act for the player and for the club.<ref name="Court case that shows who gets what from football's richest transfers">[https://www.theguardian.com/football/david-conn-inside-sport-blog/2011/jan/18/jorge-mendes-super-agent?intcmp=239 "Court case that shows who gets what from football's richest transfers"] by David Conn, ''[[The Guardian]]'', 18 January 2011. Retrieved 14 January 2015.</ref>
GestiFute was also involved in part-owning the economic rights of a number of these players. In July 2003, Porto bought 20% of Brazilian-born Portuguese professional footballer [[Deco]]'s rights from GestiFute in exchange for €2.25 million, plus 5% of the economic rights for Ricardo Carvalho and Paulo Ferreira. Shortly afterwards, GestiFute sold a further 15% of Deco's economic rights to the club, this time in return for €1.25 million and 10% of striker [[Benni McCarthy]]'s rights.<ref name="Why">[https://www.theguardian.com/sport/david-conn-inside-sport-blog/2011/feb/03/chelsea-david-luiz "Why £5.25m of the money Chelsea paid for David Luiz went to investors"] by David Conn, ''[[The Guardian]]'', 3 February 2011. Retrieved 14 January 2015.</ref>
===After Chelsea=== After Mourinho's departure from Chelsea in September 2007,<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/7003912.stm "Mourinho makes shock Chelsea exit"], [[BBC]], 20 September 2007. Retrieved 11 July 2012.</ref> Mendes oversaw his move to [[Inter Milan]] in 2008 for a fee that made him the highest paid coach in the world,<ref name="bar"/> and then, in May 2010, that which saw him move from Inter to become [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]]'s manager on a four-year contract worth £40 million.<ref>[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/european_football/article7134144.ece "Mourinho to quit for £40m Real Madrid deal"] by Duncan Castles, ''[[The Sunday Times]]'', 23 May 2010. Retrieved 14 January 2015.</ref><ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/8699064.stm "Jose Mourinho's move to Real Madrid 'to take time'"], [[BBC]], 25 May 2010. Retrieved 2 August 2010.</ref>
In 2008, Mendes also handled the deal that took the manager [[Luiz Felipe Scolari]] to Chelsea, negotiating a three-year contract worth between £5.5 million and £6.25 million.<ref name="How"/> At that summer's [[UEFA Euro 2008]] tournament, Mendes had been allowed privileged access to the [[Portugal national football team|Portugal national team]]'s hotel by Scolari, who was then managing the national side.<ref name="How"/>
====Ronaldo, Nani and Anderson==== Mendes oversaw the transfer of Cristiano Ronaldo from Sporting CP to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for £12.24 million in 2003 and in 2007 those of [[Anderson (footballer, born 1988)|Anderson]] and [[Nani]] to the same club for £46 million. The Nani transfer reportedly followed only once the player had dropped his existing agent, Ana Almeida.<ref name="rise"/><ref name="How"/> That summer, Mendes was also responsible for the transfers of [[Pepe (footballer, born 1983)|Pepe]] to Real Madrid for £25 million and [[Simão Sabrosa|Simão]] to [[Atlético Madrid]] for £16.5 million.<ref name="How"/>
Mendes' association with Anderson reflected the connections he established in South America, in which he worked closely with [[Pini Zahavi]].<ref name="bar"/> Part of the deal that took Anderson to Manchester United saw his previous club Porto pay Mendes a reported £4 million for his share of Anderson's registration. Mendes was said to have contributed 20% of the £3.75 million Porto paid [[Grêmio Foot-Ball Porto Alegrense|Grêmio]] in Brazil to sign the midfielder in 2006.<ref name="Jose agent's £4m jackpot on Anderson">[https://archive.is/20130114053124/http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/sport/article-23398861-jose-agents-4m-jackpot-on-anderson.do "Jose agent's £4m jackpot on Anderson"], [[The Evening Standard]], 1 June 2007. Retrieved 2 August 2010.</ref>
In 2009, Mendes was reported to have made £4 million from Cristiano Ronaldo's £80 million transfer from Manchester United to Real Madrid.<ref name="bar"/>
====Bebé transfer==== In August 2010, football agent Gonçalo Reis complained that he had been left on the sidelines when [[Bebé]], a player he represented, was transferred to Manchester United from Vitória de Guimarães. "When Mendes arrived," Reis said, "I was out of the transaction."<ref name="cut">[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/7966189/Bebes-former-agent-claims-he-was-cut-out-of-Manchester-United-transfer-deal.html "Bébé's former agent claims he was cut out of Manchester United transfer deal"] by Mark Ogden, ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'', 26 August 2010. Retrieved 26 August 2010.</ref> In July 2010, Reis arranged Bebé's move to Vitória as a free agent from [[C.F. Estrela da Amadora|Estrela da Amadora]] in the semi-professional Portuguese third division after the cancellation of the player's contract due to the club's inability to pay his wages. Manchester United signed Bebé for a reported fee of £7.4 million five weeks later, when he had played just six pre-season friendlies for Vitória. Reis received notification that he had been sacked by Bebé in a letter dated 5 August that arrived two days before the completion of the Manchester United transfer on 11 August.<ref name="cut"/><ref name="Bébé">[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/may/10/portugese-police-manchester-united-bebe-transfer "Portuguese police to question Manchester United over Bébé transfer"] by David Conn, ''[[The Guardian]]'', 10 May 2012. Retrieved 11 July 2012.</ref><ref name="interesting">[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/may/10/bebe-manchester-united-portuguese-police "Bébé, Manchester United and the deal interesting the Portuguese police"] by David Conn, ''[[The Guardian]]'', 10 May 2012. Retrieved 14 January 2015.</ref> Reis officially took his complaints to [[FIFA]] in May 2012.<ref name="interesting"/>
At Vitória's subsequent general meeting, the club's directors revealed that Mendes had received €3.6 million of the €9 million fee from the Bebé transfer, with reports in Portugal suggesting that €2.7 million of that sum came from the 30% of the player's economic rights initially retained by Bebé when he moved to Vitória but bought from the player by Mendes for €100,000.<ref name="Bébé"/><ref name="street">[https://www.theguardian.com/football/david-conn-inside-sport-blog/2011/jan/20/manchester-united-bebe "How Manchester United's Bébé went from street kid to €9m player"] by David Conn, ''[[The Guardian]]'', 20 January 2011. Retrieved 20 January 2011.</ref><ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/8091164/Manchester-Uniteds-Bebe-deal-saw-sports-agency-Gestifute-net-30-per-cent-of-transfer-fee.html "Manchester United's Bébé deal saw sports agency Gestifute net 30 per cent of transfer fee"] by Mark Ogden, ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'', 28 October 2010. Retrieved 14 January 2015.</ref> Emilio Macedo, club president of Vitória de Guimarães club, called Mendes "the bulwark of this transfer" and defended the agent, saying, "With all due respect to other agents, this country owes him a lot because he handles large transfers and brings money into the country because this is like an export."<ref name="cut"/> The transfer was subsequently investigated by the Portuguese police.<ref name="Bébé"/><ref name="interesting"/>
Manchester United's then manager, [[Alex Ferguson|Sir Alex Ferguson]], admitted that he had not seen Bebé play before signing the player.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/aug/17/manchester-united-transfer-window "Sir Alex Ferguson breaks the mould bringing Bébé to Manchester United"] by Paul Wilson, ''[[The Guardian]]'', 18 August 2010. Retrieved 15 January 2015.</ref> He had reportedly been recommended to the club by [[Carlos Queiroz]], who had two spells as assistant manager at Manchester United and who at that time was coach of the Portugal national team.<ref name="Bébé"/> Queiroz's relationship with United had been important in the transfers of Anderson and Nani in 2007; he is also represented by Mendes.<ref name="Bébé"/>
===2014 summer transfer window=== Mendes brokered four of the seven biggest deals worldwide during the 2014 summer transfer window from which he earned an estimated £30 million. [[James Rodríguez]] moved to Real Madrid from [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] for £63 million, [[Ángel Di María]] from Real Madrid to Manchester United for £60 million, [[Diego Costa]] from Atlético Madrid to Chelsea for £32 million and [[Eliaquim Mangala]] from Porto to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] for £32 million.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/shortcuts/2014/sep/02/jorge-mendes-football-agent-transfer-deadline-day-di-maria-man-utd-costa-chelsea "Jorge Mendes: the football agent who just won transfer deadline day"] by Diego Costa, ''[[The Guardian]], 2 September 2014</ref>
===Third-party ownership accusations=== On 22 September 2014, an investigation by ''[[The Guardian]]'' implicated Jorge Mendes alongside ex-Manchester United and -Chelsea chief executive [[Peter Kenyon]] in breaching [[FIFA]] regulations regarding third-party ownership and conflict of interest in player representation, buying player rights through companies based in [[Jersey]] and [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]].<ref name=powerful>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/sep/22/-sp-jorge-mendes-agent-third-party-ownership-players "Jorge Mendes: the most powerful man in football?"] by David Conn, ''[[The Guardian]]'', 22 September 2014</ref> This followed another report published in January 2014 suggesting Kenyon's ex-club Chelsea have invested in third-party ownership via Mendes and Kenyon, a practice banned by the Premier League. Chelsea declined to comment on the accusations.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/30/chelsea-links-third-party-ownership "Questions for Chelsea over links to third-party ownership of players"] by David Conn, ''[[The Guardian]]'', 30 January 2014</ref> On 23 September 2014, [[UEFA]] announced their intention to crack down on the practice of [[Third-party ownership in association football|third-party ownership]].<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/sep/23/uefa-third-party-ownership-champions-league "Uefa plans rule change to clamp down on third-party player ownership"] by Owen Gibson and David Conn, ''[[The Guardian]]'', 23 September 2014</ref>
===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== After the takeover of English [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] by [[Fosun International]], Mendes was implemented as an agent for the club.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jun/19/jorge-mendes-wolves-influence-chinese-owners-signings |title= Jorge Mendes and Wolves: how deep does the agent’s influence run? |publisher=The Guardian |date=19 June 2017 |accessdate=19 January 2018}}</ref> Along with the help of team general manager Andrea Butti and sporting director [[Kevin Thelwell]], 12 players were signed within six weeks during the 2016 summer transfer window.
===Tax avoidance=== In December 2016, leaked documents suggested that Mendes was involved in a massive tax avoidance scheme with both Mourinho and Ronaldo accused of not paying taxes by using offshore accounts.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://elpais.com/elpais/2017/06/22/inenglish/1498127640_892693.html |title=Spain’s Tax Agency puts the spotlight on soccer super agent Jorge Mendes |publisher= El Pais |date=22 June 2017 |accessdate=26 June 2018}}</ref>
===Swansea City=== Mendes began working with [[Premier League]] club [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] during the January 2018 transfer window, assisting the club in identifying players for newly-appointed manager [[Carlos Carvalhal]]. Previously, he brought Portugal U21 midfielder [[Renato Sanches]] to the club, on loan from [[Bayern Munich]], in August 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/01/19/swansea-turn-jorge-mendes-help-transfer-window-signings/ |title=Swansea turn to Jorge Mendes to help with transfer window signings |publisher= The Telegraph |date=19 January 2018 |accessdate=19 January 2018}}</ref>
==GestiFute and CAA== In 2008, GestiFute announced that it had entered into partnership with [[Creative Artists Agency]] (CAA) in the United States to "create global opportunities for current and future clients", following CAA's expansion into the sports market.<ref>[http://www.businesswire.com/portal/site/home/permalink/?ndmViewId=news_view&newsId=20080709005068&newsLang=en "CAA Sports and International Soccer Agency Gestifute Create Global Partnership to Represent Top Talent"], ''[[Business Wire]]'', 9 July 2008. Retrieved 2 August 2010.</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
== External links == *[http://www.gestifute.com/gestifute/index.php Official GestiFute Website]

revision.text:
{{About|scientist||Kenan Şahin}} {{Infobox person | image = | caption = | name = Kenan E. Sahin | birth_name = Kenan Eyup Sahin | birth_place = Turkey | residence = Massachusetts | citizenship = United States | alma_mater = [[MIT Sloan School of Management]] | occupation = Businessman }} '''Kenan Eyup Sahin''' (generally known simply as Dr. Kenan Sahin) is a [[Turkish people|Turkish]]-born American Scientist and Entrepreneur. He is the Founder/ President and the Chief Technology Officer of TIAX LLC in [[Lexington, Massachusetts]]. He is also the Founder/CEO of CAMX Power which formerly was a division of [[TIAX|TIAX LLC]] and in May 2014 became a separate company.
==Early life and education== He was born in [[Aydin]], [[Turkey]]. He completed elementary school in Aydin, graduated from Robert Academy (middle school) in Istanbul Turkey. He started high school at Robert Lycee but completed it at [[Inglewood High School (California)|Inglewood High School]] in California. He then started his college work at Robert College (now the Bosphorus University) and then transferred to MIT as a junior to finish his BS as well as his PhD at MIT.
==Business career== The early years of Dr. Sahin's entrepreneurial career overlapped with the final years of his academic career which began at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and continued at MIT with interleaved periods at Robert College of Istanbul (now the Bosphorus University) [[Harvard University]], and the [[University of Massachusetts Amherst]]. He has global patents and numerous academic publications.
In 1982, Dr. Sahin founded Kenan Systems with a $1,000 personal investment, as part of his outreach activities while at MIT. The company grew to become a world leader in telecommunications software, creating nearly 1,000 professional jobs. Dr. Sahin was named the Ernst & Young New England Entrepreneur of the Year in 1998.
In 1999, Dr. Sahin sold Kenan Systems to [[Nokia Bell Labs|Lucent Technologies/Bell Laboratories]] for $1.5 billion in a stock swap when the Lucent stock was trading at $50 a share. Subsequent to the sale, accepting a two year offer from Lucent/Bell Labs, he became Vice President of Software Technology at Bell Labs, a member of the managing group of Bell Labs and then the President of Lucent’s Software Products Group, managing 4,500 people. The same year he made a major unrestricted gift to MIT, the largest ever until then, which MIT allocated to its School of Humanities and Social Science, also endowing the Dean of the same school.
Dr. Sahin left Lucent/Bell Labs in early 2001 to return to Boston and later to start TIAX LLC. He significantly expanded TIAX in early 2002 by acquiring assets and hiring staff from the Technology and Innovation unit of [[Arthur D. Little|Arthur D. Little, Inc.]] which had come to an end.
In 2003, the World Economic Forum named Dr. Sahin one of its 40 Technology Pioneers. He received the New England Business and Technology's first "Circle of Excellence" award in 2004. In 2006, he was given the Golden Door Award by the International Institute of Boston in recognition of his achievements as both an entrepreneur and an academic. In 2007, TIAX was recognized as one of the Global Growth companies by the World Economic Forum, and Dr. Sahin was invited to Davos-East held in Dalian, China to address Innovation. In 2010, he was awarded the Ellis Island Medal of Honor and this recognition was entered into the US Congressional records. In 2015, he was given an honorary doctorate in engineering by [[Bosphorus University]] in [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]].
===TIAX=== Using its laboratories, scientists, engineers and technicians, and links to innovation sources, TIAX selects and matures early stage technologies primarily in energy into innovative, de-risked, IP-based and market-ready proto-products for service-supported licensing, sale or joint. CAMX Power is one major result of the TIAX model. Its flagship product CAM-7, one of the most advanced [[cathode]] materials for [[lithium-ion battery]] applications in the automotive and high-end portable electronics markets has been licensed for scaled up production by one of the largest chemical/material companies.
==Board memberships== He serves on the Board of MIT (life member), Council of Competitiveness Executive Committee, the Board of Robert College of Istanbul and the Board of Overseers of the [[Boston Symphony Orchestra]] ( Emeritus). He served on the Board [[Argonne National Laboratory]], [[National Electrical Manufacturers Association]] Board in Washington, DC, on the MIT Energy Initiative Advisory Board, on the Boards of [[Museum of Fine Arts, Boston]], [[AFS Intercultural Programs]], and as a team member for the Center for the Study of the Presidency and Congress.
==Personal life== Dr. Sahin currently resides in Massachusetts.
== References == {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20050410192440/http://www.tiaxllc.com/aboutus/pdfs/press_releases/nebus_honors_sahin_061504.html Dr. Kenan Sahin Honored] * [http://web.mit.edu/echemi/www/040512.html Kenan Sahin Playlist] Appearance on WMBR's ''[http://web.mit.edu/echemi/www/index.html Dinnertime Sampler]'' radio show May 12, 2004 * [http://web.mit.edu/newsoffice/2000/kenan.html $75 million Kenan Sahin Fund announced for humanities, arts, and social sciences at MIT] * [http://www.boston.com/globe/search/stories/reprints/secondacts102703.htm SECOND ACTS: Taking R&D projects and running them to market is a TIAX specialty]

page.title: Korea Institute for Advancement of Technology

revision.comment: Add: date, title. Converted bare reference to cite template. You can [[WP:UCB|use this bot]] yourself. [[WP:DBUG|Report bugs here]]. | [[WP:UCB|User-activated]]; [[Category:Innovation economics]].
revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = Korea Institute for Advancement of Technology (KIAT)

([[Hangul]]: 한국산업기술진흥원) | logo = Official Logo Korea Institute for Advancement of Technology.jpg | type = [[institute|Public Institute]] | founded = 2009 | location_city = [[Seoul]] | location_country = Republic of Korea | revenue = {{unbulleted list| [[United States dollar|US$]]1.17bn (2012)}}[http://erawatch.jrc.ec.europa.eu/erawatch/opencms/information/country_pages/kr/organisation/organisation_0009?tab=template&country=kr Erawatch Korea Institute for Advancement of Technology] | num_employees = {{unbulleted list| 257 (2012)}} | homepage = {{URL|www.kiat.or.kr}} }} The '''Korea Institute for Advancement of Technology (KIAT)''' is a quasi government-public institute under the Korean [[Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy]]. Formed in May 2009, the main functions of KIAT include analyzing and formulating Korean R&D and industrial policy, acting as an industrial technology innovation funding agency, creating Korea's industrial and technological ecosystem, and fostering international technological cooperation. KIAT has an annual budget of circa one billion dollars, and employs 257 staff. (2012)[http://www.newsworld.co.kr/cont/article2009/0905-36.htm NewsWorld .NOVEMBER 2006] == History == KIAT was formed in May 2009 by the merger and consolidation of six previous Korean government and public institutes: ITEP (Korea Institute of Industrial Technology Evaluation and Planning), KOTEF (Korea Industrial Technology Foundation), KTTC (Korea Technology Transfer Center), IITA (Institution for Information Technology Advancement), KMAC (Korea Materials and Components Industry Agency), and KIDP (Korea Institute of Design Promotion). == KIAT Presidents == http://www.oecd.org/site/stigfke/48529471.pdf {{cite web | url=http://www.etnews.com/news/people/2822443_1617.html | title=[이사람]정재훈 Kiat 신임 원장, 두발을 땅에 딛고 일하겠다| date=2013-09-02}} {|border="1" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" align="left" |- ! scope="col" style="background:#efefef;" | Date ! scope="col" style="background:#efefef;" | President |- |May, 2009–September, 2013 |Kim Yong Geun (김용근) |- |September, 2013–present |Chung Jae Hoon (정재훈) |} == Project Funding and grants == In 2012, KIAT distributed circa US$940m in technology project grants and R&D funding.[http://k-economy.na.go.kr/site?siteId=site000003451&pageId=page000003607&bd_mode=read&bd_pageNumber=1&bd_searchTerm=&bd_searchKeyword=&bd_recordId=2012070031079 자료실 > 참고자료] == Events == KIAT is responsible for organizing numerous annual technology, R&D, and collaboration events. These include the tech+ forum and Eureka day events. === tech+ forum === The [[Tech Plus Forum]] ('tech+ forum') has been held since 2009 in Korea. It is a 'knowledge concert' that gathers leading experts in innovation and inspiration to discuss themed-topics over the course of a two-day event. The name Tech+ is derived from technology, economy, culture and humanity. In 2012, tech+ was held under the theme of ‘dream@technology'.[http://sunday.joins.com/article/view.asp?aid=28078 중앙 SUNDAY] === Eureka Day === [[EUREKA]] is a pan-European collaborative R&D network that was established in 1985. It currently has 41 full member countries [http://www.eurekanetwork.org/in-your-country In your country - EUREKA] and Korea is an associate member. KIAT acts as the EUREKA NCP (National Contact Point) for Korea, and since 2011 has held an annual Eureka day event to advance Korea-European cooperation and innovation via matchmaking and seminars.[http://nwww.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20110213000304 EUREKA connects Korea’s R&D sector-The Korea Herald][http://www.eurekanetwork.org/showevent?p_r_p_564233524_articleId=1329135&p_r_p_564233524_groupId=10137 2012 KOREA EUREKA Days - EUREKA Events - EUREKA] == References == {{Reflist}} == Notes == {{note|reference_name_stats}}Reference #4. Figures derived and calculated from Korean government official statistics, Knowledge Economy Committee, Korean National Assembly, accessed Jan 09, 2013. == External links == * [http://www.kiat.or.kr/ Homepage (Korean)] * [http://www.kiat.or.kr/site/main/index/index002.jsp/ Homepage (English)] * [http://techplusforum.com/html/te1.html/ techplus forum (English)] * [http://gpkorea.or.kr/engOmain.do?cmd=omain/ KIAT's Global Partnership Program (English)] * [http://www.eurekaday.kr/default.asp/ Eureka Day(English)] * [http://www.motie.go.kr/language/eng// Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy (English)] [[Category:Articles created via the Article Wizard]] [[Category:Technology strategy]] [[Category:Technology development]] [[Category:Innovation organizations]] [[Category:Innovation economics]] [[Category:Knowledge transfer]] [[Category:Organizations based in Seoul]]

{{Infobox settlement | official_name = Kulim Hi-Tech Park | native_name = Taman Teknologi Tinggi Kulim | other_name = | nickname = | website = {{URL|http://www.khtp.com.my/}}
{{URL|http://www.pbttphtk.gov.my/}} | image_skyline = File:Kulimtechpark.jpg | imagesize = 250px | image_caption = | image_seal = | pushpin_map = | pushpin_mapsize = | map_caption = | subdivision_type = [[Countries of the world|Country]] | subdivision_type1 = [[States of Malaysia|State]] | subdivision_name = [[Malaysia]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Kedah]] | established_title = Establishment | established_date = 1996 | established_title2 = | established_date2 = | leader_title = | leader_name = | area_total_km² = 1305.08 acres | area_district_km² = | population_as_of = 2 | population_total = | population_metro = | population_footnotes = | population_density_km2 = | timezone = [[Malaysian Standard Time|MST]] | utc_offset = +8 | timezone_DST = Not observed | postal_code_type = [[List of postal codes in Malaysia|Postal code]] | postal_code = | coordinates = {{coord|5|21|36|N|100|32|59|E|region:MY|display=inline,title}} | blank_name = [[Telephone numbers in Malaysia|International dialling code prefix]] | blank_info = +6044 (landline only) | footnotes = }} The '''Kulim Hi-Tech Park''' ('''KHTP'''; {{lang-ms|Taman Teknologi Tinggi Kulim}}) is an [[industrial park]] for [[high tech]]nology enterprises located in [[Kulim District]], [[Kedah]], [[Malaysia]]. ==History== KHTP opened in 1996 and became Malaysia's first high-tech industrial park. {{cite web|url=http://siteselection.com/issues/2010/nov/Kulim-IP.cfm|title=Science Park Powers a Solar System|work=Site Selection Magazine|date=9 November 2010}} It was key component in the nation's plan to be fully industrialized by 2020.The park is operated by Kulim Technology Park Corporation Sdn Bhd, subsidiary of the Kedah State Development Corporation {{cite web|url=http://www.pknk.gov.my/index.php%3Foption%3Dcom_content%26view%3Darticle%26id%3D755%26Itemid%3D312|title='Kulim Hi Tech Park'|work=Kedah State Development Corporation|date=9 November 2010}} {{cite web|url=http://www.khtp.com.my/about/ |title='About US'|publisher=''KHTP Official Website ''|date=9 November 2010}} ==Location== The park comprises a total area of 4,510 acres. ==Tenants== [[File:Lakehightechkulim.jpeg|250px|thumb|Lake at Kulim Hi Tech Park]] The major companies located at Kulim Hi-Tech Park are [[First Solar]], [[Infineon Technologies]] and [[Intel]]. Companies located in KHTP :- * [[Abbott Laboratories]] * AIC Semiconductor{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=9048822 |title='Company Overview of AIC Semiconductor Sdn. Bhd.'|publisher=''BLOOMBERG ''|date=9 November 2010}} * [[Air Products & Chemicals|Air Products]] * [[BASF]] * BCM Electronics Corp {{cite web|url=http://www.bcmcorp.com.my/corporateinfo.htm |title='Corporate Info.'|publisher=''BCM Electronic corp site ''|date=9 November 2010}} * [[Celestica]]{{cite web|url=https://www.celestica.com/about-us/locations#asia |title='About us-Location'|publisher=''Celestica ''|date=9 November 2010}} * [[Entegris]] * [[First Solar]] * Fuji Electrics * Fujimi Micro Technology * Fronkten Malaysia * Hamadatec * Hoya Electronics * [[Infineon Technologies]] * [[Intel]] * MIMOS * NUR Distribution * [[OSRAM]] * Panasonic Energy * [[Pfeiffer Vacuum]] * [[Saint-Gobain|Saint - Gobain Solar]] * Sentienx * Showa Denko * [[Silterra Malaysia]] * SIRIM Berhad * Smartrac Technology * [[Teleflex]] * Toyo Memory Technology * Wong Engineering Industries * 5NPV Malaysia ==School== Taman Hi-Tech School (Jawi: سكوله كبڠساءن تامن هاي-تيك) is a school in Kulim Techno City (KTC), located 5 kilometers from Kulim, 35 kilometers from Butterworth 49 kilometers from Bandar Baharu, 121 kilometers from Alor Star and 136 kilometers from Ipoh. ==References== https://sktamanhitech.wordpress.com/info-sekolah-2/]] {{commons category|Kulim Hi-Tech Park}} [[Category:1996 establishments in Malaysia]] [[Category:High-technology business districts in Malaysia]] [[Category:Kedah]]

{{Chinese |pic=06.19 總統接見「貝里斯眾議院塔蘿拉暨參議院議長鄭經緯一行」 (Flickr id 41080872310).jpg |t = 鄭經緯 |s = 郑经纬 |p = Zhèng Jīngwěi }}
'''Lee Mark Chang''' is a [[Belize]]an politician and restaurateur. A member of the [[United Democratic Party (Belize)|United Democratic Party]], he was the first [[Ethnic Chinese in Belize|ethnic Chinese]] person to hold the post of [[President of the Senate of Belize|President]] (''[[pro tempore]]'') of the [[Senate of Belize]].<ref name="Reporter20100820">{{cite news|url=http://www.reporter.bz/index.php?mod=archive&act=view&article=4557|title=Belize's first Chinese President of the Senate|work=The Belize Reporter|date=2010-08-20|accessdate=2012-04-24}}</ref>
==Career==
===Early career=== Lee got his start in life working at the Chon Saan Palace restaurant which his father Armando Chang opened in 1974. From a small family restaurant, under his management he grew it to a chain with three locations and fifty staff, making it "one of the biggest names in restaurants".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.7newsbelize.com/sstory.php?nid=12628|title=7 On the Inside of Chon Saan Palace's Kitchen|work=7 News Belize|date=2008-11-12|accessdate=2012-04-22}}</ref> He also became the president of the Chinese Association of Belize.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edition.channel5belize.com/archives/13922|title=Chinese-Belizeans celebrate New Year|work= News 5 Belize|date=2004-01-22|accessdate=2012-04-24}}</ref> Under his tenure as president, the CAB worked closely with the [[Belize Police Department]] on issues of crime prevention, and also donated several motorcycles.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://7newsbelize.com/sstory.php?nid=16923|title=The Chinese Community’s Contribution|work=7 News Belize|date=2010-05-18|accessdate=2012-04-24}}</ref> He also served in a variety of public positions, for example sitting on the Belize District Liquor Licensing board and working as an occasional court translator.<ref name="Amandala20090220">{{cite news|url=http://www.amandala.com.bz/index.php?id=8190|first=Aaron|last=Humes|title=Archie Lee and Wilmot square off!|work=[[Amandala]]|date=2009-02-20|accessdate=2012-04-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://belize.me.uk/2010/05/14/chinese-national-pays-fine/|title=Chinese National pays $1000 fine for frying chicken|work=Belize Local News|date=2010-05-14|accessdate=2012-04-24}}</ref>
===In politics=== Chang first announced his intention to join electoral politics in August 2009.<ref name="News520090806">{{cite news|url=http://edition.channel5belize.com/archives/904|title=Lee Mark Chang: 1 citizenship and 100% Belizean|work=News 5 Belize|date=2009-08-06|accessdate=2012-04-24}}</ref> In August 2010, [[Prime Minister of Belize|PM]] [[Dean Barrow]] appointed Chang to the Senate and made him acting President, to fill in for [[Andrea Gill]] who was on [[maternity leave]]. Politicians from both sides of the aisle such as the PUP's [[Lisa Shoman]] offered congratulations to him on what they described as "the epitome of Belize's cultural diversity" and an "important milestone" for Belize's Chinese community.<ref name="Reporter20100820"/>
Lee entered the [[Belizean general and local elections, 2012|2012 "double election"]] as the UDP's [[National Assembly of Belize|National Assembly]] candidate for the Freetown constituency. In the run-up to the election, an unknown person released a forged letter claiming to be from Chang, promising to distribute land in Belama to the Belize Chinese Association in exchange for campaign contributions.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://7newsbelize.com/sstory.php?nid=21897|title=Lee Mark Cries Foul in Freetown|work=7 News Belize|date=2012-02-29|accessdate=2012-04-22}}</ref> The ''[[Belize Times]]'' also published a number of racist comments about him.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.bz/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=4450:pup-trying-to-inject-racism-in-freetown&catid=53:headlines|first=Shane|last=Williams|title=PUP Trying to Inject Racism in Freetown|work=Belize Guardian|date=2012-03-01|accessdate=2012-04-22}}</ref> Lee lost the election to PUP party leader [[Francis Fonseca]] by 1,558 to 1,408 votes.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.lovetv.com.bz/2012/04/04/cj-approves-application-for-election-petition-against-francis-fonseca/|title=CJ approves application for election petition against Francis Fonseca|work=Love TV Belize|date=2012-04-04|accessdate=2012-04-24}}</ref> In early April Chang filed a motion for an [[election petition]] in April, alleging that Fonseca's agents engaged in bribery of the electorate. [[Chief Justice of Belize|Chief Justice]] [[Kenneth Benjamin (judge)|Kenneth Benjamin]] granted him leave to bring the petition; it was the first election petition in Belize's history to be granted on the grounds of bribery.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.7newsbelize.com/sstory.php?nid=22149|title=Bribery Petition Against PUP Leader Granted Leave To Be Heard|work=7 News Belize|date=2012-04-04|accessdate=2012-04-24}}</ref>
2015: He became the President of the Senate, after the United Democratic Party won their 3rd term.
==Personal life== Chang's parents are Chinese immigrants.<ref name="Reporter20100820"/> He was born at the former Holden Memorial Hospital on the Marine Parade in [[Belize City]].<ref name="News520090806"/>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Chang, Lee Mark}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Belizean people of Chinese descent]] [[Category:Members of the Senate (Belize)]] [[Category:People from Belize City]] [[Category:United Democratic Party (Belize) politicians]] [[Category:Belizean businesspeople]]

revision.text:
'''Leland Lawrence Briggs''' (April 24, 1893 – November 12, 1975) was an American accounting scholar, and Professor at the [[University of Vermont]], known as founder of ''The Accountants Digest,'' which he edited and published until 1973.<ref>''Harvard Business School Bulletin,'' Vol. 51-52 (1975). p. 32</ref><ref name="JTW 1980">James Terry White (1980) ''The National cyclopaedia of American biography.'' p. 145</ref>
== Biography == Briggs was born in [[Byron, Minnesota]] to Edward Wellington, a farmer, and Alice (McPeak) Briggs. After primary education in Byron and [[Rochester, Minnesota]], he obtained his BA in 1923 and his MA in 1924 both at the [[University of South Dakota]]. Subsequently, he obtained MBA at [[Northwestern University]] in 1927 with the thesis, entitled "Some Legal Aspects of Goodwill."<ref>Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.) (1928) ''Bulletin.''</ref> and his PhD from [[Harvard University]] in 1930-31.<ref name="JTW 1980"/>
Briggs had started his career as teacher at the public school in 1911. In 1924 he was appointed Professor of commerce at [[McPherson College]] in Kansas. In 1926 had joined the Northwestern University as Noyes scholar. In 1927 he moved to the [[University of Vermont]], where he served the rest of his academic career.<ref name="JTW 1980"/> He had started as assistant professor in economics, was promoted associate professor in 1929, and in 1952 to professor of economics.<ref>''The American economic review,'' Vol. 42. (1952), p. 510</ref><ref>Alfred Grether Buehler (1937) ''The Undistributed Profits Tax,'' p. viii.</ref><ref>''Ayer Directory, Newspapers, Magazines and Trade Publications.'' (1945). p. 920.</ref>
In 1935 Briggs founded the accounting periodical ''Accountants Digest.'' The first issue included digests of "120 articles taken from 48 periodicals published in the United States, Canada, England, Australia, New Zealand and Scotland."<ref>''Management Accounting,'' Vol. 17, Nr. 1 (1935), p. 327</ref> He edited and published the periodical until 1973, and then sold it to E. Samuel Germain, Professor of Syracuse University.<ref>Leland Lawrence Briggs (1981) ''The Accountants Digest.'' Vol. 47</ref>
== Selected publications == * Briggs, Leland Lawrence. ''Centralized Accounting Control for the Small Business.'' 1924. * Briggs, Leland Lawrence, ed. ''[http://catalog.hathitrust.org/Record/005328349 The Accountants Digest.]'' Vol. 3. Germain Publishing Company, 1937.
=== Articles, a selection === * Briggs, L. L. "Goodwill–Definition and Elements in Law." ''Journal of Accountancy'' (September 1928) (1928): 194-203. * Briggs, L. L. "Accounting in Collegiate Schools of Business." Accounting Review (1930): 175-181. * L. L. Briggs, "Stock Dividends." ''The Journal of Accountancy,'' March, 1930, pp. 193–201. * Briggs, L. L. "Accounting and the courts." ''Accounting Review'' (1931): 184-191. * L. L. Briggs: Dividends from stock premiums. ''Journal of Accountancy,'' Nr. 5. May 1932. * L. L. "Appreciation and Dividends." ''The Journal of Accountancy,'' July, 1932, pp. 29–37. * Briggs, L. L. "Stockholders' Liability for Unlawful Dividends." ''Temp. LQ'' 8 (1933): 145. * L. L. Briggs, “Asset Valuation in Dividend Decisions,” ''The Areounting Review'' (September 1934), pp. 184–191
== References == {{reflist|2}}
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Briggs, Leland Lawrence}} [[Category:1893 births]] [[Category:1975 deaths]] [[Category:American accountants]] [[Category:American business theorists]] [[Category:Accounting academics]] [[Category:University of South Dakota alumni]] [[Category:Kellogg School of Management alumni]] [[Category:Harvard University alumni]] [[Category:Northwestern University faculty]] [[Category:University of Vermont faculty]] [[Category:People from Olmsted County, Minnesota]] [[Category:McPherson College faculty]]

page.title: List of Boeing 737 MAX orders and deliveries

revision.comment: /* Orders and deliveries by customer */
revision.text:
This article lists the orders made by airlines and other buyers for the [[Boeing 737 MAX]] family of aircraft, which is currently being produced by [[Boeing Commercial Airplanes]], a division of the [[Boeing|Boeing Company]].
Initially, the customers for the 737 MAX were not disclosed, except for [[American Airlines]]. On November 17, 2011, Boeing released the names of two other customers – [[Lion Air]] and [[Aviation Capital Group]]. At that time, Boeing reported 700 commitments from nine customers for the 737 MAX.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/lion-air-commits-to-up-to-380-boeing-737s-365027/ |title=Lion Air commits to up to 380 Boeing 737s |date=November 17, 2011 |accessdate=November 17, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/acg-becomes-third-identified-737-max-customer-365044/ |title= ACG Becomes third identified 737 MAX customer |date=November 17, 2011 |accessdate=November 17, 2011}}</ref> Then on December 13, 2011, [[Southwest Airlines]] announced they would be the launch customer for the 737 MAX with a firm order of 150 aircraft and 150 options.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/92380/000119312511342458/d271438dex991.htm |title=Southwest Airlines Will Become Launch Customer for the New Boeing 737 Max Aircraft |date=December 13, 2011|publisher=Southwest Airlines Co. Press Release|accessdate=5 January 2017}}</ref><ref name=Boe_SW_Firm_Order>{{cite web |last=Bader |first=Tim |title=Boeing 737 MAX Logs First Firm Order from Launch Customer Southwest Airlines |url=http://boeing.mediaroom.com/index.php?s=43&item=2072 |publisher=Boeing |date=December 13, 2011 |accessdate=December 26, 2011}}</ref>
{{As of|2018|9|30|df=US}}, Boeing had 4,783 firm orders from 98 identified customers for the 737 MAX,<ref name="Boeing737_O_D"/> and the top three identified airline customers for the 737 MAX are: [[Southwest Airlines]] with 310 orders, [[Flydubai]] with 251 orders, and [[Lion Air]] with 251 orders.<ref name="Boeing737_O_D" />
==Orders and deliveries==
===Orders and deliveries by year=== {{Boeing 737 MAX orders and deliveries}}
===Orders and deliveries by customer=== The following table shows total firm orders and deliveries of Boeing 737 MAX aircraft by variant (where known) and customer, as of September 30, 2018.<ref name="Boeing737_O_D"/>
